intro: Sicyos bourgaeanus, commonly known as the golden balsam, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and squash. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are cylindrical, green when immature, and turn orange-red when ripe. Sicyos bourgaeanus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
